title: Monsoon Alert – Storm and Heavy Rainfall Warning for these States till December 8 - Times Bull
article_text:
Monsoon Alert – Despite the monsoon season’s departure, some areas of South India are still experiencing rain. Thunderstorms and thunderstorms are still occurring in some states. Late-night rain in many areas of Kerala and Andhra Pradesh has brought down temperatures. No further relief from rain is expected here.

Rain is also falling at various places in Tamil Nadu. Winter has begun to hit several states, including Delhi and the Delhi-NCR. The drop in temperatures in Haryana, Punjab, and Uttar Pradesh has significantly increased the cold. People have started resorting to bonfires and heaters.

Read More: New Lexus RX 350h Exquisite Hybrid SUV – Perfect Combo of Luxury, Power and Hybrid Efficiency

Further cold is expected in Bihar and Jharkhand. The Indian Meteorological Department has issued a warning of heavy rain and thunderstorms in some states. You can find state-wise weather updates.

Know how the weather will be in Kerala.

According to the Meteorological Department, the weather in Kerala, known for its monsoon entry, has once again changed. The IMD has predicted heavy rain in several districts. A warning of heavy rain has been issued for several districts in the next 48 hours. Along with this, a warning has also been issued for strong winds and thunderstorms. People have been urged to exercise caution.

Weather Conditions in Andhra Pradesh

The IMD has also issued a warning for Andhra Pradesh. According to the Meteorological Department, heavy rain is expected in the coastal areas of Andhra Pradesh in the next 48 hours. Thunderstorms and lightning are also expected.

Read More: Griha Pravesh Vastu Tips – Essential Rules You Must Follow Before Entering a New Home

Rain is also expected in several states.s

According to the Meteorological Department, the weather has changed its direction in many states. An alert for heavy rain has been issued for several areas of Tamil Nadu and Telangana in the next 48 hours. A warning of heavy rain has been issued fothe r southern parts of Karnataka, Lakshadweep, Puducherry, Karaikal, Mahe, Yanam, and Rayalaseema. People have been urged to stay indoors due to the risk of lightning.
